Likelihood Ratio Test

Performs the likelihood ratio test for full and reduced model.

blr_lr_test(full_model, reduced_model)

Arguments

full_model

an object of class glm; model with all predictors
reduced_model

an object of class glm; nested model. Optional if you are comparing the full_model with an intercept only model.

Value

two tibbles with model information and test results

See also

lrtest

Examples

# compare full model with intercept only model
# full model
model_1 <- glm(honcomp ~ female + read + science, data = hsb2,
            family = binomial(link = 'logit'))

blr_lr_test(model_1)
#> $model_info
#> # A tibble: 2 x 4
#>   model         formulas      log_lik   d_f
#>   <chr>         <list>          <dbl> <int>
#> 1 full model    <S3: formula>     160     4
#> 2 reduced model <chr [1]>         231     1
#> 
#> $test_result
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>   lr_ratio   d_f             p_value
#>      <dbl> <dbl>               <dbl>
#> 1     71.1  3.00 0.00000000000000254
#> 

# compare full model with nested model
# nested model
model_2 <- glm(honcomp ~ female + read, data = hsb2,
            family = binomial(link = 'logit'))

blr_lr_test(model_1, model_2)
#> $model_info
#> # A tibble: 2 x 4
#>   model         formulas      log_lik   d_f
#>   <chr>         <list>          <dbl> <int>
#> 1 full model    <S3: formula>     160     4
#> 2 reduced model <S3: formula>     171     3
#> 
#> $test_result
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>   lr_ratio   d_f p_value
#>      <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1     10.7  3.00  0.0138
#>
